definition: to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to invert right and wrong
to invert

sentences.english: As he, in his swooning ears, the choir's amen.
sentences.chinese: 神魂颠倒的耳中，只想听到唱诗班的歌。

sentences.english: You got it all upside down, " shouted Matt at Thorne."
sentences.chinese: “你完全搞颠倒啦，”麦特向桑恩嚷起来。

sentences.english: He lost his head over that woman.
sentences.chinese: 他叫那个女人给弄得神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: We use it to describe someone who confuses right and wrong deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 我们用它来形容那些故意颠倒是非的人。

sentences.english: Have nothing in your heart, for you will also become topsy-turvy.
sentences.chinese: 没有在你的心里，你也将成为颠倒。

sentences.english: In a word, Sophia was in love with him to distraction.
sentences.chinese: 简单一句话，苏菲亚爱他爱得神魂颠倒了。

sentences.english: But the merry men preferred to call him Little John .
sentences.chinese: 但罗宾汉一伙把他的姓和名颠倒过来，改成了小约翰。

sentences.english: Why not turn it upside down?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不把它上下颠倒呢？

sentences.english: Actually I am spaced-out all day.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我一天都神魂颠倒的。

sentences.english: An upside-down one reveals a different world.
sentences.chinese: 而上下颠倒的地图则展示了一个不同的世界。

sentences.english: Relation between them is principal and subordinate, which cannot be reversed.
sentences.chinese: 两者之间是主从的关系，不能互相颠倒。

sentences.english: Her wit, her voice my heart beguiles.
sentences.chinese: 她的幽默风趣，她的悦耳声音，让我神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: Before him, of course, others had turned her head.
sentences.chinese: 在他之前，她当然为别人神魂颠倒过。

sentences.english: It'll drive you crazy at first.
sentences.chinese: 一开始会叫你神魂颠倒的。

definition: in disorder/deranged (mentally)
to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head
to invert
confusion
can't tell black from white (idiom); unable to distinguish wrong from right
yin and yang
to confuse/to befuddle
thus and so/such and such
not divided/irrespective/not distinguishing between
to obscure/to confuse/to mix up/to blur/to mislead
positive and negative/pros and cons/inside and outside
completely/sharply (differing)
to distinguish (between different things)/to make distinctions clear
to change (sth)/to alter (sth)/to change over (to sth else)
to contradict oneself/self-contradictory/inconsistent
attitude/mindset/prejudice
